name: superlu-mt

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
SuperLU is a general purpose library for the direct solution of large,
sparse, nonsymmetric systems of linear equations on high performance
machines. SuperLU_MT is designed for shared memory parallel machines.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
AMD Optimized BLIS. BLIS is a portable software framework for
instantiating high-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.
The framework was designed to isolate essential kernels of computation
that, when optimized, immediately enable optimized implementations of
most of its commonly used and computationally intensive operations.
LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing and using this
software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the AMD AOCL-BLIS
license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/blis/blis-4-0-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/blis/blis-eula.html

dependent_to.name: sundials
dependent_to.description:
SUNDIALS (SUite of Nonlinear and DIfferential/ALgebraic equation
Solvers)

dependent_to.name: gridlab-d
dependent_to.description:
Autotools package for Gridlab-D, a new power distribution system
simulation and analysis tool that provides valuable information to users
who design and operate distribution systems, and to utilities that wish
to take advantage of the latest energy technologies. Gridlab-D is a
flexible simulation environment that can be integrated with a variety of
third-party data management and analysis tools.
